data.title: add support for file:///-links
data.body: When detecting links we should also support the `file` schema

data.title: Open file (Ctrl+O) should use directory of currently edited file as starting point

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 SP1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open folder in the VSCode with many subdirectories
2. Navigate to some file in sub-sub directory and start to edit it
3. Press Ctrl+O to open other file from the same directory of currently edited file
4. But open file dialog starts with something really different directory, probably with directory I last used Ctrl+O with.
5. That's counter-intuitive and in usual Visual Studio it works the way I expect it to behave.

Should I enable some hidden config rule to get desired behaviour?

data.title: source maps don't work if drive letter case does not match
data.body:
OS Version: **Windows**
- generate a source map where the 'sourceRoot' uses an absolute path starting with a drive letter.
- set a breakpoint in the source and try to hit it
- edit the source map and change the case of the drive letter
- restart the debug session and try  to hit it again

Observe: the breakpoint will be only hit once

The problem is a path comparison in node-debug that doesn't ignore the case of the drive letter.

data.body:

Steps to Reproduce:

markdown code as follows can't preview:
### LaTeX 公式

可以创建行内公式，例如 $\Gamma(n) = (n-1)!\quad\forall n\in\mathbb N$。或者块级公式：
$$  x = \dfrac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a} $$

data.title: select text - equals are highlighted only to 1000 rows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select a text at the editor
2. If you have 2000 rows with equal texts then the one selected, those are highlighted only to 1000 row. The other ones are not highlighted .

data.title: [loc][Query][DevDiv] Please clarify placeholder
data.body:
Hi, we have a query from our translator and I was hoping you could help. Thanks!

source:
Cannot launch debug target in terminal ({0}).

File Name:
out\node\nodeDebug.nls.resx

Resource ID:
".resx", 0; "VSND2011"

query:
What are the possible contents of {0}? Does it refer to the terminal or must the position be at the end of the sentence?    DE_Translator2  5/10/2016 9:58:04 PM

data.title: empty string should be a valid value for a virtual document
data.body:
- have a document provider that return `""`
- 💥 an error happens, the empty string should be a valid result

data.title: Linux CLI fails to open files with spaces in filename
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  _Version 1.1.1
  Commit def9e32467ad6e4f48787d38caf190acbfee5880
  Date 2016-05-13T13:38:00.094Z
  Shell 0.37.6
  Renderer 49.0.2623.75
  Node 5.10.0_
- OS Version:
  _ubuntu 14.04_

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a file w/ spaces in its filename
2. try to open it via terminal, e.g:

``` bash
code "file with spaces.js"
code "file\ with\ spaces.js"
code file\ with\ spaces.js
```

are all dealt as

``` bash
code file with spaces.js
```

visual studio code fails to manage argv array and to open the file, instead it opens three different files, like "file with spaces.js".split(' ')

ps: nice editor btw ;)

data.title: Automatically pull in references in like in Eclipse or Visual Studio
data.body:
Is there a way to configure Visual Studio Code so that the intellisence will automatically inset "using" statements (reference to class library) just like in Eclipse or Visual Studio does?

In Visual Studio we can use SHIFT + ALT + F10:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/301004/15389248/da270b7c-1dad-11e6-8d39-1a8bbd65cfd5.png)

data.title: npm packages do not refresh after 'npm install' or 'npm update' is ran on the folder

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.1.1 (1.1.1)
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan 10.11.4 (15E65)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Instal an npm package for an older version of a the package
2. Try to update it via the `npm install` or `npm update` commands
3. The package is downloaded correctly but the contents of the 'node_modules' folder are not being refreshed and show the old content (which is no longer available)
4. Restarting VS Code fixes the issue and shows the new updated packages in the 'node_modules' folder

This started happening in the latest version from what I have observed.

data.title: shortcut name: might goToDefinition be better than goToDeclaration?
data.body:
Hello, 

About the key shortcut

``` son
{ "key": "f12",                   "command": "editor.action.goToDeclaration",
                                     "when": "editorTextFocus" },
```

 We know that `definition` and `declaratoin` are different in programming, and the actual action of f12 is going to definition, not declaration.

Maybe this is a subtle issue, but it will be good for a better vs code.

data.title: Adopt IDisposable over ListenerUnbind (e.g. WorkbenchComponent)
data.body: All of { (): void; }[]

data.title: Reuse FileEditorInput instead of always creating new
data.body: Every click in the explorer or search results in a new FileEditorInput to be created. We should rather use the IResourceInput API instead and have a cache at the layer where the input gets resolved to a EditorInput type.

data.title: How to set the output directory with tasks.json
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.1
- OS Version: win8.1

I am using tasks.json to transpile ts to js. However, all the output js files and map files are generated in the same directory with ts files. I want to set the output directory with tasks.json, but how?

```
{
    // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "tsc",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": ["-p", "."],
    "showOutput": "silent",
    "problemMatcher": "$tsc"
}
```

data.title: only CSharp extension cannot install.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  1.1.1
- OS Version:
  RHEL 7.2

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  type `Ctrl+P` and `ext install csharp`
2. The status bar at the left bottom remains "installing" status. It doesn' t finish for several hours.

I get into this situation only csharp extension. I can install other extensions such as go, python.
I have a workaround that I install csharp extension other Linux distro machine and copy ~/.vscode/extensions/ms-vscode.csharp-1.0.11 to RHEL machine. 
However, I'd like to know the root cause. Could you help me?

data.title: Unstage and clean selected lines short cut

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

We support staging selected lines in diff view, while we don't have clean or unstage selected lines accordingly. Unstage selected lines is not that frequent as staging does but cleaning selected lines is somewhat useful. For instance, we always make additional modifications (like unexpected code formating, tab to spaces conversion) to code while fixing bugs or adding features, you might just want to revert those unimportant lines to make the commit clean.

What do you think? Is it a valid feature request?

data.title: Editor is closing opened file when try to open a new file.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Launch an app and open smoke test project folder.
2. Click on style.css file under public\stylesheets\style.css
3. Now click on users.js and verify list of opened files under Open Editors.
Actual: Only one file is showing up e.g. users.js
Expected: Both Style.css and Users,js should be displayed in the Open Editors section.
![replacefileinopeneditor1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15382016/2446cefa-1d3a-11e6-9d42-68fbdcf406c8.gif)

data.title: Split editor control is not working with Markdown preview.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open smoke test project folder.
2. Open readme.md file.
3. Click on "Open Preview" button.
4. Verify preview in split screen and click on split editor button from preview window.
Actual: No action when user click on "Split editor" button.
Expected: Should open new screen with split screen.

![spliteditoronpreview](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15380585/8616e92a-1d2c-11e6-85fb-e2ed35a32a1c.gif)

data.title: [Suggestion] GoTo->SwitchGroup->NextGroup and PreviousGroup should work in round-robin.
data.body: When we are working with multi-screen and active window is to last then command "Goto->SwitchGroup->NextGroup" didn't perform any action. I think it is by design but I personally feel it would be good if we can move focus to the first screen when user perform NextGroup action from last screen.

data.title: After opening a file it should remain in working files even though its not edited
data.body:
A lot of times you want to look at a file for reference e.g the generated js while you modify ts.

The working files tend only only keep files with modification. It should behave like sublime where it stays open

data.title: "-" character doesn't work for triggering snippets
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: win 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add this snippet
   {
   "Method Comment Header": {
       "prefix": "--",
       "body": [
           "// -------------------------------------------------------------------------",
           "\t$1"
       ],
       "description": "Method Comment Header"
   }
   }
2. Try to trigger it via "--"
   It does not work
3. Try triggering via normal letter characters, say "hh"
   Works fine.
